thread.title: Tennessee Titans QB Marcus Mariota declared out for Sunday with knee injury
thread.title_full: Tennessee Titans QB Marcus Mariota declared out for Sunday with knee injury

title: Tennessee Titans QB Marcus Mariota declared out for Sunday with knee injury
text:
Tennessee Titans QB Marcus Mariota declared out for Sunday with knee injury Rookie QB didn't practice all week because of knee injury suffered Sunday. Post to Facebook Tennessee Titans QB Marcus Mariota declared out for Sunday with knee injury Rookie QB didn't practice all week because of knee injury suffered Sunday. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/1S0XGm7 Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 3 To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Tennessee Titans QB Marcus Mariota declared out for Sunday with knee injury Jason Wolf, USA TODAY 2:05 p.m. EDT October 23, 2015 Marcus Mariota will not play Sunday. (Photo: Christopher Hanewinckel, USA TODAY) 8 CONNECT 54 TWEET LINKEDIN 3 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Marcus Mariota has been ruled out for Sunday’s game against the Falcons at Nissan Stadium because of a sprained medial collateral ligament in his left knee, Titans coach Ken Whisenhunt said after the rookie quarterback sat out his third consecutive practice Friday. 
Backup quarterback Zach Mettenberger will start. Mettenberger, a sixth-round draft pick in 2014, started six of the seven games he played in last season, all of them Titans losses. He completed 59.8 percent of his passes for 1,412 yards, eight touchdowns, seven interceptions and an 84.4 passer rating. Miami Dolphins DE Oliver Vernon fined $17,363 for low hit on Marcus Mariota 
Mariota was injured on a low, late hit by Dolphins defensive end Olivier Vernon in the second quarter of a 38-10 loss Sunday in Nashville. Mariota, the second overall pick in this year’s draft, remained in the game and committed four turnovers before being replaced by Mettenberger for the team’s final possession. Mettenberger completed 5 of 8 passes for 63 yards. 
The NFL has fined Vernon $37,363 for two roughing the passer penalties against Mariota. He’s docked $17,363 for the low hit and $20,000 for a hit to the head. 
The Titans (1-4) have lost four games in a row and eight consecutive at home. 
Jason Wolf writes for The Tennessean.
